io.atomix.copycat.client

Interface CopycatClient

  • All Superinterfaces:
    CopycatService, Managed<CopycatClient>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultCopycatClient

    public interface CopycatClient
extends CopycatService, Managed<CopycatClient>
    Provides an interface for submitting commands and Query queries to the Copycat cluster.

    Copycat clients are responsible for connecting to the cluster and submitting commands and queries that operate on the cluster's replicated state machine. Copycat clients interact with one or more nodes in a Copycat cluster through a session. When the client is opened, the client will attempt to one of the known member Address provided to the builder. As long as the client can communicate with at least one correct member of the cluster, it can open a session. Once the client is able to register a Session, it will receive an updated list of members for the entire cluster and thereafter be allowed to communicate with all servers.

    Sessions are created by registering the client through the cluster leader. Clients always connect to a single node in the cluster, and in the event of a node failure or partition, the client will detect the failure and reconnect to a correct server.

    Clients periodically send keep-alive requests to the server to which they're connected. The keep-alive request interval is determined by the cluster's session timeout, and the session timeout is determined by the leader's configuration at the time that the session is registered. This ensures that clients cannot be misconfigured with a keep-alive interval greater than the cluster's session timeout.

    Clients communicate with the distributed state machine by submitting commands and queries to the cluster through the CopycatService.submit(Command) and CopycatService.submit(Query) methods respectively: 

       
   client.submit(new PutCommand("foo", "Hello world!")).thenAccept(result -> {
     System.out.println("Result is " + result);
   });
    All client methods are fully asynchronous and return CompletableFuture. To block until a method is complete, use the CompletableFuture.get() or CompletableFuture.join() methods.

    Sessions

    Sessions work to provide linearizable semantics for client commands. When a command is submitted to the cluster, the command will be forwarded to the leader where it will be logged and replicated. Once the command is stored on a majority of servers, the leader will apply it to its state machine and respond according to the command's Command.consistency(). See the Command.ConsistencyLevel documentation for more info.

    Sessions also allow queries (read-only requests) submitted by the client to optionally be executed on follower nodes. When a query is submitted to the cluster, the query's Query.consistency() will be used to determine how the query is handled. For queries with stronger consistency levels, they will be forwarded to the cluster's leader. For weaker consistency queries, they may be executed on follower nodes according to the consistency level constraints. See the Query.ConsistencyLevel documentation for more info.

    Throughout the lifetime of a client, the client may operate on the cluster via multiple sessions according to the configured RecoveryStrategy. In the event that the client's session expires, the client may reopen a new session and continue to submit operations under the recovered session. The client will always attempt to ensure commands submitted are eventually committed to the cluster even across sessions. If a command is submitted under one session but is not completed before the session is lost and a new session is established, the client will resubmit pending commands from the prior session under the new session. This, though, may break linearizability guarantees since linearizability is only guaranteed within the context if a session. Users should watch the client for state changes to determine when linearizability guarantees may be broken. See the CopycatClient.State documentation for more info.

    • Method Detail

      • builder

        static CopycatClient.Builder builder(Address... members)
        Returns a new Copycat client builder.

        The provided set of members will be used to connect to the Copycat cluster. The members list does not have to represent the complete list of servers in the cluster, but it must have at least one reachable member that can communicate with the cluster's leader.

        Parameters:
        members - The cluster members to which to connect.
        Returns:
        The client builder.

      • builder

        static CopycatClient.Builder builder(Collection<Address> members)
        Returns a new Copycat client builder.

        The provided set of members will be used to connect to the Copycat cluster. The members list does not have to represent the complete list of servers in the cluster, but it must have at least one reachable member that can communicate with the cluster's leader.

        Parameters:
        members - The cluster members to which to connect.
        Returns:
        The client builder.

      • state

        CopycatClient.State state()
        Returns the current client state.

        The client's CopycatClient.State is indicative of the client's ability to communicate with the cluster at any given time. Users of the client should use the state to determine when guarantees may be lost. See the CopycatClient.State documentation for information on the specific states.

        Returns:
        The current client state.

      • onStateChange

        Listener<CopycatClient.State> onStateChange(Consumer<CopycatClient.State> callback)
        Registers a callback to be called when the client's state changes.
        Parameters:
        callback - The callback to be called when the client's state changes.
        Returns:
        The client state change listener.

      • context

        ThreadContext context()
        Returns the client execution context.

        The thread context is the event loop that this client uses to communicate with Copycat servers. Implementations must guarantee that all asynchronous CompletableFuture callbacks are executed on a single thread via the returned ThreadContext.

        The ThreadContext can also be used to access the Copycat client's internal serializer via ThreadContext.serializer().

        Returns:
        The client thread context.

      • transport

        Transport transport()
        Returns the client transport.

        The transport is the mechanism through which the client communicates with the cluster. The transport cannot be used to access client internals, but it serves only as a mechanism for providing users with the same transport/protocol used by the client.

        Returns:
        The client transport.

      • serializer

        Serializer serializer()
        Returns the client serializer.

        The serializer can be used to manually register serializable types for submitted commands and queries. 

           
     client.serializer().register(MyObject.class, 1);
     client.serializer().register(MyOtherObject.class, new MyOtherObjectSerializer(), 2);
        Returns:
        The client operation serializer.

      • session

        Session session()
        Returns the client session.

        The Session object can be used to receive session events from replicated state machines. Session events are named messages. To register a session event handler, use the Session.onEvent(String, Consumer) method: 

           
   client.session().onEvent("lock", v -> System.out.println("acquired lock!"));
        When a server-side state machine publishes an event message to this session, the event message is guaranteed to be received in the order in which it was sent by the state machine. Note that the point in time at which events are received by the client is determined by the Command.consistency() of the command being executed when the state machine published the event. Events are not necessarily guaranteed to be received by the client during command execution. See the Command.ConsistencyLevel documentation for more info.

        The returned Session instance will remain constant as long as the client maintains its session with the cluster. Maintaining the client's session requires that the client be able to communicate with one server that can communicate with the leader at any given time. During periods where the cluster is electing a new leader, the client's session will not timeout but will resume once a new leader is elected.

        Returns:
        The client session or null if no session is open.

      • open

        CompletableFuture<CopycatClient> open()
        Connects the client to the Copycat cluster.

        When the client is opened, it will attempt to connect to and register a session with each unique configured server Address. Once the session is open, the client will transition to the CopycatClient.State.CONNECTED state and the returned CompletableFuture will be completed.

        The client will connect to servers in the cluster according to the pattern specified by theconfigured ServerSelectionStrategy.

        In the event that the client is unable to register a session through any of the servers listed in the provided Address list, the client will use the configured ConnectionStrategy to determine whether and when to retry the registration attempt.

        Specified by:
        open in interface Managed<CopycatClient>
        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed once the client's session() is open.

      • recover

        CompletableFuture<CopycatClient> recover()
        Recovers the client session.

        When a client is recovered, the client will create and register a new Session. Once the session is recovered, the client will transition to the CopycatClient.State.CONNECTED state and resubmit pending operations from the previous session. Pending operations are guaranteed to be submitted to the new session in the same order in which they were submitted to the prior session and prior to submitting any new operations.

        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed once the client's session is recovered.

      • close

        CompletableFuture<Void> close()
        Closes the client.

        Closing the client will cause the client to unregister its current Session if open. Once the client's session is unregistered, the returned CompletableFuture will be completed. If the client is unable to unregister its session, the client will transition to the CopycatClient.State.SUSPENDED state and continue to attempt to reconnect and unregister its session until it is able to unregister its session or determine that it was already expired by the cluster.

        Specified by:
        close in interface Managed<CopycatClient>
        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed once the client has been closed.
